Fire up Powershell

Use WSL

wsl.exe --list --verbose
wsl.exe --set-default Ubuntu

To run a specific wsl distribution from within PowerShell:
wsl.exe --distribution Ubuntu

or

wsl



Getting started with Linux and Bash
08/06/2025
This tutorial will help those new to Linux to get started installing and updating packages using the Ubuntu distribution of Linux that is installed by default using WSL, as well as using some basic commands with the Bash command line.


Installing and Updating Software
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> wsl
luket@DESKTOP-0VOK0VD:/mnt/c/WINDOWS/system32$ sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade

luket@DESKTOP-0VOK0VD:/mnt/c/WINDOWS/system32$         /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"
==> Checking for `sudo` access (which may request your password)...

==> Next steps:
- Run these commands in your terminal to add Homebrew to your PATH:
    echo >> /home/luket/.bashrc
    echo 'eval "$(/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/brew shellenv)"' >> /home/luket/.bashrc
    eval "$(/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
- Install Homebrew's dependencies if you have sudo access:
    sudo apt-get install build-essential

Git repo

core.repositoryformatversion=0
core.filemode=true
core.bare=false
core.logallrefupdates=true
remote.origin.url=git@github.com:torpyluke-ship-it/lab.git
remote.origin.fetch=+refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*

branch.main.merge=refs/heads/main

Make sure you can access GitHub
luket@DESKTOP-0VOK0VD:~/.ssh$ ssh -vT git@github.com
